OK.

Is Breaking Ground getting its own forum section?

If it is, I think it would be better to have the first setup here, as it would be less clutter, especially if there's going to be more DLC in the future. (Community parts for structure reference)

**Main Page:**

- Community
    - Welcome Aboard
    - Science & Spaceflight
    - Kerbal Network
    - The Lounge
        - Forum Games
- Expansions
    - Making History
        - Making History Missions
        - Making History Discussion
        - Making History Support
    - Breaking Ground
        - Breaking Ground Discussion
        - Breaking Ground Support

Versus keeping the current format.

**Main Page:**

- Community
    - Welcome Aboard
    - Science & Spaceflight
    - Kerbal NetworkThe Lounge
        - Forum Games
- Making History Expansion
    - Making History Missions
    - Making History Discussion
    - Making History Support
- Breaking Ground Expansion
    - Breaking Ground Discussion
    - Breaking Ground Support

Not particularly. That would pretty quickly turn into a chat thread, and those aren't allowed here.

What are actually your point of concern to approve the posts of a new forum member? Do you just try to filter out the spam bots or do you also block posts which are not conform to the rules?

Every once in a while, I come across a post where I have to ask myself: How did this post got any approval by a mod?  

I'm not going to quote any examples since I don't want to blame anyone (neither the mod how approved it, nor the forum member) but if you're curious, I will report these posts in the future.

> 
> 
> 23 minutes ago, 4x4cheesecake said:
> 
> 
> What are actually your point of concern to approve the posts of a new forum member? Do you just try to filter out the spam bots or do you also block posts which are not conform to the rules?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Every once in a while, I come across a post where I have to ask myself: How did this post got any approval by a mod?  
> 
> I'm not going to quote any examples since I don't want to blame anyone (neither the mod how approved it, nor the forum member) but if you're curious, I will report these posts in the future.
> 

It's primarily an anti-bot measure, but we also deal with rule-breaking posts that we find there. There's no harm in reporting them. Sometimes we overlooked the context or interpreted it in a different way than you did. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") Also, though, we may have already acted on it in a way that isn't visible to the public.

I've reported a few that screamed "I'm a robot!" when I read it.  I've been right and wrong.. I think.

> 
> 
> On 6/9/2019 at 1:21 PM, Geonovast said:
> 
> 
> I've reported a few that screamed "I'm a robot!" when I read it.  I've been right and wrong.. I think.
> 

Thre's absolutely nothing wrong with reporting threads that you think might be even slightly amiss, what ever the reason.  As long as you give us a little bit of info to work with in the report editor, the worst that can happen, for the most part, is we go "Eh.... nothing to see here, carry on".  We know most people are reporting threads for the good of the forums, and not some personal agenda, although that does happen every now and then.  

But the worst type of report is the one that does not explain anything about why they are reporting the post.   We only see the post you are reporting not the whole thread.  Yeah we can click on some links to get there, but If we have to do much digging to figure why it got reported in the first place, it just makes the job harder.    So a little context with each report helps.   Even if it's just a little blurb like "Wrong forum" "Swearing" or "This user has summoned Zuul and we need to do something about it before it gets out of hand".   That way we know what we're looking for when we dive into it, and we can prioritize the workflow if we need to.   Although, that last one would require three other mods to agree to cross the streams, even though we agreed to never cross the streams, and then cover a large metropolitan neighborhood in marshmallow cream.  And given that the moderation team is a global force, getting us altogether that quick might be a logistical nightmare.   So if that happens, expect us to deputize some of you that are local to each other so we can fight the scourge as a solid front.
